channel.title: Run bat error
channel.description:
So I'm really pretty new at this, so please don't judge :|
I use to do a little bit of development back before I quit about 3 years ago, I'm trying to get back in to it and just want to see what I can still remember, and what I can create.
I wanted to start of with the most random source I can find honestly the first thing I saw, but each one I downloaded always gave me an error when I ran the source or the client, I was hoping someone could tell me why this keeps coming up.
I hear you need eclipse, or something like that to run the server. I don't remember needed any of that back then, that's why I'm asking, is that going to help?
Here is an example of what the client did when tried running it.
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Jframe : Unsu pported major.minor version 51.0 at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: Jframe. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Run bat error
item.dc:creator: @I_like_pie_moo I like pie moo
item.description:
@I_like_pie_moo wrote:

[quote=“Fire capez, post:2, topic:525273”]looks like incompatible jdk and jre versions, the jre runtime runs the bytecode the jdk compiles which in this instance the code has been compiled with a version of jdk higher then jre

basically, make sure jdk and jre are at the same version and upgrade them to a higher version if they are (if you can) if all else fails recompile it.

as for eclipse it does have a feature called compiler compliance level (window - preferences - compiler: set compiler compliance level to the version e.g 1.6)[/quote]

Big thanks to you! Very helpful and fast and accurate answer! Downloaded the correct versions and it works like a charm ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Run bat error
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

looks like incompatible jdk and jre versions, the jre runtime runs the bytecode the jdk compiles which in this instance the code has been compiled with a version of jdk higher then jre

basically, make sure jdk and jre are at the same version and upgrade them to a higher version if they are (if you can) if all else fails recompile it.

as for eclipse it does have a feature called compiler compliance level (window - preferences - compiler: set compiler compliance level to the version e.g 1.6)

Read full topic
